description: Indicates the device enrollment type. For example, corporate owned and fully managed enrollment or dedicated device enrollment.
title: Enrollment Type

description: This key specifies whether the Set Device Wallpaper setting can be changed by the end user. Setting the value true would enable end user to change this setting, admin specified wallpaper would take effect at the first time deployment only, to keep end user's preference be prioritized. Setting the value false would disable end user to change this setting.
title: Set Device Wallpaper User Change Allowed

description: Allows you to set a wallpaper of your choice by entering the URL of the image that you want to set as a wallpaper.
title: Set Device Wallpaper

description: This key specifies whether the feed on -1 page would be on. Setting the value to true will enable the feed.
title: Feed Enable

description: This key specified whether the Feed Enable setting can be changed by the end user. Setting the value true would enable end user to change this setting, admin specified Feed Enable value would take effect at the first time deployment only, to keep end user's preference be prioritized.
title: Feed Enable User Change Allowed

description: Allows you to set the grid size for apps to be positioned on the managed home screen. You can set the number of app rows and columns to define grid size in the following format columns;rows. If you define the grid size, the maximum number of apps that will be shown in a row on the home screen would be the number of rows you set and the maximum number of apps that will be shown in a column in the home screen would be the number of columns you set.
title: Set Grid Size

description: Allows you to define the set of apps visible on the home screen from amongst the apps installed on the device. You can define the apps by entering the app package name of the apps that you would like to make visible, for example com.microsoft.emmx would make settings accessible on the home screen. The apps that you allow-list in this section should already be installed on the device in order to be visible on the home screen.

nestedProperties.description: Application
The application package name.
nestedProperties.title: Package Name

nestedProperties.description: The application activity, which is specific to a certain app page. It would use the default app page if this value is empty.
nestedProperties.title: Class Name
Application

title: Set Allow-Listed Applications

description: This key specifies whether the Home Screen App Order setting can be changed by the end user. Setting the value true would enable end user to change this setting, admin specified app order would take effect at the first time deployment only, to keep end user's preference be prioritized. Setting the value false would disable end user to change this setting.
title: Home Screen App Order User Change Allowed

description: Allows you to specify the order of applications on Home Screen.

nestedProperties.description: Order
Currently, the "application", "weblink" and "folder" types are supported.
nestedProperties.title: Type

nestedProperties.description: The application icon slot on home screen.
nestedProperties.title: Position

nestedProperties.description: The application package name.
nestedProperties.title: Package Name

nestedProperties.description: The application activity, which is specific to a certain app page. It would use the default app page if this value is empty.
nestedProperties.title: Class Name

nestedProperties.description: The web link name that will show under the icon.
nestedProperties.title: Link Label

nestedProperties.description: The URL address this weblink will point to.
nestedProperties.title: Link URL

nestedProperties.description: Allows end user to change folder content settings. If set to "True", end user is allowed to change the folder content setting. If set to "False", then end user is not allowed to make changes in folder content.
nestedProperties.title: Home Screen Folder Content User Change Allowed

nestedProperties.description: Folder
Content
Currently, the "application" and "weblink" types are supported. In the future, the product will support other types.
nestedProperties.title: Type

nestedProperties.description: The application package name.
nestedProperties.title: Package Name

nestedProperties.title: Link Label

nestedProperties.description: The URL address this weblink will point to.

Content
Folder
Order

title: Application Order

description: Allows end user to change folder style setting. If set to "True", the folder shape, the way of opening a folder, and the folder scroll direction will only be enforced in the initial deployment. Subsequently, end user can make changes to the folder style settings. If set to "False", the folder shape, the way opening a folder, and the folder scroll direction will be enforced and end user won't be able to change it.
title: Folder Style User Change Allowed

description: Allows you to change folder style. You can set the folder shape, the way of opening a folder, and the folder scroll direction.

nestedProperties.description: You can set folder shape to one of the five values: "Rounded square", "Square", "Squircle", "Round" and "Teardrop".
nestedProperties.title: Folder Shape

nestedProperties.description: If you set openFullScreen to "True", the folder will open in the full screen. If set to "False", the folder will not open in the full screen, and will open in pop up mode instead.
nestedProperties.title: Folder Open Full Screen

nestedProperties.description: If you set folderScroll to "Vertical", end user can scroll through pages within folder vertically. If the setting is "Horizontal", end user can scroll through pages within folder horizontally.
nestedProperties.title: Folder Horizontal Scroll

title: Folder Style

description: This key allows you to pin websites to the home screen as quick launch icons. That way, you can make sure end users have quick and easy access to essential websites.

nestedProperties.description: Web Link
The web link name that will show under the icon.
nestedProperties.title: Link Label

nestedProperties.description: The URL address this weblink will point to.
nestedProperties.title: Link URL
Web Link

title: Set Pinned Web Links

description: This key specifies whether the end user can change the Dock Mode setting. "True" allows the end user to change the dock mode setting. The admin specified value will go into effect during the initial launch, but the end user will be able to change this setting later. "False" makes it impossible for the end user to change the dock mode setting.
title: Dock Mode User Change Allowed

description: This key controls the setting of dock mode on home screen. Setting the value Show or Disabled, would specify if the dock is enabled or not. If it's Hidden, the dock is invisible but can be shown by dragging the handler at the bottom of screen.
title: Dock Mode

description: This key specifies whether the end user can change the search bar placement setting. "True" allows the end user to change the search bar placement. The admin specified value will go into effect during the initial launch, but the end user will be able to change this setting later. "False" makes it impossible for the end user to change this setting.
title: Search Bar Placement User Change Allowed

description: This key controls the search bar placement setting. The search widget on home screen will be removed if it's Hidden, while the widget position would adjust accordingly when it's set as Top or Bottom.
title: Search Bar Placement
